lenders.name: Oak
lenders.loan_because: Life is so much harder in other parts of the world.  I want to help better another person's life, by giving them the opportunity to help themselves.  I feel fortunate to be able to help in my small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a wife,  mother of 2 young girls, and a Registered Nurse.

lenders.loan_because: I am very grateful for the abundance I have been blessed with and I would like to share it with others.

lenders.name: Lori
lenders.loan_because: I want to set a good example for my son. I want to show him how one person can make a difference.

lenders.name: Dale
lenders.loan_because: I owned a small business myself for much of my working life.  I just love entrepreneurs and the whole idea of entrepreneurship.  To use it to help people around the world get out of poverty is just about the most exciting idea I have ever heard of!

lenders.name: Claudia
lenders.loan_because: I strive daily to live a compassionate, grace-filled life that includes service to others.  I can't say it always works!
lenders.occupational_info: My husband and I were merchant marines.... for the last ten years of our working lives we helped run a fish processing "mothership".  Smaller fishing boats brought us their fish catch and we would process it and freeze it.

lenders.name: Aaron

lenders.name: Andy
lenders.loan_because: We live like royalty in this country compared to most of the world - the money I will have in Kiva projects will be unnoticable to me, yet very important for someone across the world.  I want my children to participate (and lend) as well and see what it is about.
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies simplify complicated websites and make it easier for people to find information they need.

lenders.name: Becky
lenders.loan_because: I want to help.  I've traveled to so many parts of the world and seen these types of entrepeneurs first hand.  Now I can make a difference in their lives.  Thank you Kiva for making this possible!

lenders.name: Kamara D
lenders.loan_because: I've been given so much in life. It's my responsibility to my fellow man (& woman) to give something in return. To those whom much has been given, much is expected...
lenders.occupational_info: I teach young children (6-8 years old) how to read, write, understand the way numbers work together. But more important, I teach them to treat every human with dignity and respect.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: Global development is a process that involves a two-pronged approach. Large corporations can have positive effects in the communities and areas where they operate (and yes, they can have negative effects, too, which is the risk of working in an imperfect system), but the reality is that even in the best of situations, the "trickle down" results of top-down development only reaches about 80-85% of any given population. The remaining 15-20% matter just as much as the top. That's why I give: I understand that there needs to be a bottom-up, grassroots effort to compensate for the shortcomings of traditional economics, and I know I am able to be a part of it. My faith calls me to respond to the needs of people in the world, and Kiva is a great way to help me live out what I believe is ultimately Christ's call in my life and the lives of those who follow him: Love God, love others.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a teacher by training, and as a youth pastor I get to teach kids something I'm passionate about besides literature: God's love and our response to that love. I'm also hoping to apply my education to some very important development work that is going to need to take place in southern Africa in the very near future.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to have a better life.
lenders.occupational_info: Manage a wide area network for a global corporation.

lenders.name: Glen and Jenna

The ability to see the people and read about their backgrounds and goals makes the effort more tangible.  We wish all of the participants the best of luck, and hope that this approach to improving the lives of others continues for a long time to come.
lenders.occupational_info: Our job is fun, tiring, stressful, unpredictable  and neccessary.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a writer and an educator

lenders.occupational_info:
I am a full time artist.
I paint with encaustic and oil sticks. I’m inspired by the bold  and bright colors that you see while walking around my native Buenos Aires, Argentina. 

During the summers I work with children. I own and run a summer camp along with another teachers in the city of Philadelphia.

lenders.occupational_info: I teach in a homeschooling co-op 2 days per week in my home. The children are ages 2 1/2 to 6 years old. One of my students is my daughter. I seek to give them a better understanding of the world and teach practical knowledge of many subjects.

lenders.name: Marc
lenders.loan_because: I feel very fortunate to live in a nation where hard work has allowed me a chance at success.  I realize that my success came in part because I was able to receive modest loans from my government and loans from some family members; these loans were used to invest in my education and business ideas.  Without such loans to give me a chance to succeed, it is likely that I would not be where I am today.    I feel that many people throughout the world are in a state that I was in twenty years ago: they are hard conscientious workers who wish to improve themselves and their lives, but they just need a loan to help get them started.  Kiva seems a perfect avenue for me to help these people in their journey towards success.
lenders.occupational_info: I used to write computer software and design systems that allow wireless phones to be used to provide data services (such as access to the internet).

lenders.loan_because: This is the way the world ought to work.

We give to course of  “OpenOffice 2”, with applied 2,0 for office. We currently have 12 professors and 320 pupils. 

We mount computers from donated parts and we develop didatico material for our pupils with resources of donations.

We need US$ 65,000 to create more 20 classromm.

lenders.name: Linden and advisees
lenders.loan_because: I have been fortunate all my life--good friends, a healthy family, opportunity for the education I wanted, and, now, work that rewards me every day.  Participating in Kiva loans will help people who were born into less easy circumstances--which only seems fair to me.
lenders.occupational_info: I help students find a way to learn about themselves, others, other times, and other circumstances through the resources our library offers them.  Because middle school is a time when that learning naturally moves to action, my advisory group of 6th, 7th and 8th graders is helping raise money for micro-lending.

lenders.name: Suzie
lenders.loan_because: I am passionate about helping others achieve their dreams and make a difference to the world. Kiva changes lives by empowering individual to create change for themselves, their families and their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: Welcome!! ☼ I inspire & empower people to live abundantly, embracing change to dream bigger dreams. Use social media to share your passion with the world. ♡

lenders.name: Jasmine & Nick

lenders.occupational_info: Jasmine works as firefighter for the federal government, and together Nick and Jasmine own and operate a Tree Service.  The services offered to residential and commercial customers are, hazardous tree removals, bucket truck work, limbing, climbing, and topping trees, chipping, stump grinding, etc.

lenders.name: Chris

This is the ultimate shopping experience!  Most rewarding!  Just try it and see if you are not addicted!
lenders.occupational_info: I have a very small, and I emphasize small, beading business that I run out of my house.  I make beaded jewlery and sell it in small situations.  My husband recently passed on and I am mostly trying to focus on my two children for right now.

This will make the world a better place to live.

"...Lord when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink, or naked, and clothe you?"

... and God replied, 'Whatever you did to one of the least of my brothers, you did it to me.'
Matthew 25:35

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I can.

Microcredit gives loans not hand-outs to individuals motivated to getting themselves and their family out of poverty. If giving what amounts to pocket change for most of us can make a difference then why not give a little.
lenders.occupational_info: My job involves clinical research and medical device development

I have been to the former Soviet Union many times and I know how incredibly difficult it is for the average person to successfully run a business.  So that is the part of the world where I would like my assistance to go to.

The picture of me is taken in front of a statue of Pushkin that was given to the city of Minsk, Belarus by the city of St. Petersburg, Russia.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at an organization that conducts applied research into sustainable land and resource management.  What I do is communicate those results to practitioners and the general public.  I also assist in developing workshops, forums and courses teaching people how to use our tools and products.

lenders.name: Marnie + Pierre
lenders.loan_because: It is a great way to help others.

lenders.name: Usha

lenders.name: Sara

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because:
At birth I was randomly dealt a pretty nice hand of cards purely by virtue of my random assignment of parents and birthplace.  The least I should be able to do is lend a hand to folks who may not have been as randomly lucky.  

Helping enable others to improve their circumstances makes a small contribution towards raising the "tide" that lifts all "boats."  That is, it contributes to the betterment of global society as a whole.
